required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study Evaluating Outcomes of Reverse Shoulder Arthroplasty With SMR Stemless
clinical_study.official_title: A Monocentric Clinical Study Evaluating Clinical and Patient-reported Outcomes of Reverse Shoulder Arthroplasty With SMR Stemless

brief_summary.textblock: The objectives of this study are the assessment of the clinical, radiographical and patient-reported outcomes of SMR Stemless Reverse Shoulder Arthroplasty (LimaCorporate S.p.A.) used as standard of care over a period of at least 2 years of follow-up and the evaluation of the incidence of any complication.

detailed_description.textblock:
The focus of this study is the evaluation on clinical, patient-reported and radiographical outcomes of SMR Stemless Reverse Shoulder Arthroplasty. There is a retrospective and prospective study population.
The follow up time-points are (as of standard of care and not different for this study):
- Baseline
- 6 weeks postop
- 6 months postop
- 12 months postop
- 24 months postop

primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the change of the Subjective Shoulder Value score from pre-operative to the last follow-up visit.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the change of the ASES shoulder score from pre-operative to the last follow-up visit.
Evaluation of the change of the Quick-Dash score from pre-operative to the last follow-up visit.
Evaluation of the change of the VAS pain score from pre-operative to the last follow-up visit.
Evaluation of the change of the UCLA shoulder score from pre-operative to the last follow-up visit.
Radiographic evaluation of the implant stability as rate and progression of symptomatic radiolucent lines and loosening.

study_pop.textblock: There is a retrospective and prospective study population. All participants are older than 18 years old and approved the written informed consent. Additionally they are suffering from rotator-cuff arthropathy and/or osteoarthritis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- rotator-cuff arthropathy, osteoarthritis
- approving written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female patients who are pregnant, nursing, or planning a pregnancy.
- All adult patients with any of the SMR Stemless contraindication for use for the reverse configuration as reported in the current local Instruction for use.
- not consenting in participating in this study
